Date of Travel: FEBRUARY 2018
Airline: Lufthansa CityLine
Livery: Lufthansa CityLine standard 
Route: FRA-ZAG
Aircraft: CRJ-900
Registration: D-ACNL
Flight Number: LH 5405
Miles: 456
Airborne time: 1h11m
Notes: None
Cost to book: Booked as part of open jaw itinerary with stopover via Croatia Airlines, LHR-FRA-ZAG (open jaw+3 month stopover) SPU-LHR, ¬£243 all in, Business Class, in the Z fare bucket during a sale. 

Thanks for finding my video and pressing play!

Join me this week as I fly on a short but pleasant flight between Frankfurt in Germany and Zagreb in Croatia. The route for this flights takes us over the Swiss Alps, so despite the weather being mostly cloudy, we‚Äôre still treated to a wonderful view of the wintry Alps from 32,000 feet. 

That kind of view is definitely the reason I love flying so much. Lufthansa are a pretty straightforward carrier who deliver what they promise in an unfussy way. I like that about them - they‚Äôre reliable and easy to get along with. However, I wish they‚Äôd tell me what food they‚Äôre serving me...I‚Äôve literally *no idea* what the meal in this video was, other than it had some prawns and beef I think. Very tasty, but if someone can tell me what it was, I‚Äôd be grateful!

If you want to find out more about my future plans and join in conversations I have about travel, follow me on Twitter: @pauls_trips. I‚Äôve started using it properly now and it would be great to see some of you there too. 

Let me know what you think of Lufthansa CityLine in the comments. I have some interesting flights to take in the next few weeks, including (much-requested) Thomas Cook from Fuerteventura to Birmingham, a Canary Islands inter-island hopper, and a spin on Luxair, Luxembourg‚Äôs neat little national carrier.
